intro: Anthocleista pynaertii, commonly known as the Congo moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, angular fruits. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Anthocleista pynaertii is often found in moist forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
